alert.note: Alert for Big Island East; Big Island North (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 15 at 12:41AM HST until October 15 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR THE NORTH FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI AND BIG ISLAND... .The current north swell, at between 340 and 360 degrees, is generating low end advisory surf along the north facing shores of the main Hawaiian Islands. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Large breaking waves ranging between 12 to 16 feet. * WHERE...North facing shores of Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST this evening. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution.

area.areaDesc: Big Island East; Big Island North
